chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Yanquoi Gayvolor Stanley was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Yanquoi Gayvolor Stanley was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
With huber privileges (WAIVED first 48 hours).  Jail to commence on or before March 28, 2016.  
19 days credit if probation revoked.
Seek/maintain full time employment/school or combination of both.

Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent.  Not to go to taverns/bars or business where primary purpose of business is sale of alcohol.  Absolute Sobriety.  ALL COURT ORDERED OBLIGATIONS TO BE PAID THROUGH CLERK OF COURTS

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Yanquoi Gayvolor Stanley in court with attorney Leonie Dolch.  Defendant Yanquoi Gayvolor Stanley in custody.  Michael Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and parties state appearances.  Atty Dolch states matters are resolved w/a joint recommendation.  State is in agreement.  Court will proceed w/revocation in 15CF83 first.  Atty Dolch rec/rev revocation packet and there are no corrections to be made.  State makes statement.  Atty Dolch makes statement.  DE makes brief statement.  Court sentences on 15CF83.  DE advised of rights re: voting, appeals and felony firearms warnings.  Parties address probation on Ct 3 of 15CF83.  Court believes it is an oversight by DOC in not revoking the probation on Ct 3.  Court will do nothing today w/count 3.  Court questions DE on prelim waiver in 17CF311.  DE agrees.  Court accepts waiver/finds probable cause and binds over.  State files information.  Atty Dolch acknowledges rec. information, waives reading.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Atty Dolch enters NC plea to Ct 1 in 17CF311.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on plea/accepts/finds guilty.  State makes statement.  Atty Dolch makes statement.  DE makes brief statement.  Court admonishes DE and sentences in 17CF311.  Atty Dolch and DE note they have waived the right to a PSI in 17CF311.

15CF83
Ct 1:
72 months prison (36 months Initial Confinement and 36 months Extended Supervision)
Conditions of Extened Supervision:
AODA and any follow-up treatment per agent
Revoke DL 36 months
IID for 36 months effective upon licensure
Absolute sobriety at all times
Not to operate MV w/o valid DL
441 days sentence credit to be applied
DE is eligible for SAP and CIP

17CF311
Ct 1:  NC
72 months prison concurrent to 15CF83 but consecutive to any other sentence (36 months Initial Confinement and 36 months Extended Supervision)
Conditions of Extended Supervision:
AODA and any follow-up treatment per agent
Absolute sobriety at all times
Not to operate MV w/o valid DL 
Not to go to any taverns or liquor stores
$1819.00 fine/surcharges and $100.00 blood draw fees to be paid as a condition of extended supervision to Clerk's Office
DNA sample to be provided
Revoke DL 36 months
IID for 36 months effective upon licensure
88 days sentence credit to be applied
DE is eligible for SAP and CIP
Ct 2:  Dismissed
Cts 3 and 4:  Dismissed/read-in
Sentencing hearing on revocation on October 4, 2017 at 11:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on September 28, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Yanquoi Gayvolor Stanley in court with attorney Melville Peter Middleton.  Defendant Yanquoi Gayvolor Stanley in custody.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion to modify conditions of probation w/huber privileges.  Atty. Middleton makes statement, State is seeking to remove work release privileges, deny motion or find appropriate time is past.  DE has already spent 30 days w/o work release since the offense. Atty. Albrecht makes statement. Revocation of work privileges for an a time frame of 90 days is appropriate, seeking Court for the appropriate time. Court is satisfied of the 90 days that State is recommending.  Start from the date that DE first went into custody w/o work release.
Motion hearing on October 12, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Yanquoi Gayvolor Stanley in court with attorney Melville Peter Middleton.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   State's motion to amend information and other matters.  No objection to amend information.  Court grants motion to amend information to add Count of obstruction. Next motion - Admission of criminal convictions.  Parties believe can be solve on day of trial.  No issue on witnesses. Bond continues. 
'

Yanquoi Stanley appears with Attorney Middleton. Sue Mueller for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has been in contact with Attorney Middleton.  Arrived late today.    Information received, waived reading.  Stands Mute, Court enters Not Guilty Plea, set for trial.  Warrant issuance quashed.

Attorney Melville Peter Middleton in court.  Sue Mueller and Rick S. appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Middleton unsure why defendant is not present. Contact has been good today.  Request reset.  State request warrant, stayed.    Based on non-appearance, court authorized warrant.  Arraignment scheduled for June 26, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Yanquoi Gayvolor Stanley in court with attorney Melville Peter Middleton.  Michael Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and State state appearances.  State notes DE will waive prelim today.  Atty Middleton agrees and written waiver provided.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on prelim waiver/accepts/finds probable cause and binds over.  Bond continued.  Arraignment scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Yanquoi Gayvolor Stanley in court with attorney Melville Peter Middleton.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Middleton request preliminary hearing.  Bond continues.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Return date on April 7, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Yanquoi Gayvolor Stanley in court with attorney Melville Peter Middleton.  Defendant Yanquoi Gayvolor Stanley in custody.  Michael Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and parties state appearances.  Bond modification filed by defense is addressed by Atty Middleton/requesting lesser cash bond be ordered as DE has local ties and is unable to post the required cash bond.  State responds they are opposed to any bond modification.  Atty Middleton responds.  Court denies motion for bond modification and bond will remain at $1,500.00 cash.  All other conditions will also remain as previously ordered.

Pre-trial conference on March 20, 2015 at 11:30 am.
Return date on March 31, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Yanquoi Gayvolor Stanley appeared by video means from LEC w/atty. Peter Middleton. Prosecuting Atty Linda A. Hoffman appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  DE is eligible for PD representation.  State requests $3000 Cash bond.   Atty. Middleton makes argument for Signature bond w/conditions.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits waived.  $1500.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Absolute Sobriety; Not operate m/v w/o valid DL; Submit to chemical testing if requested.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 20, 2015 at 11:30 am.  Return date scheduled for March 31, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
